result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: Order of Commitment for Treatment to Competency

Defendant Patrick J Niergarth in court, in custody with attorney Rebecca Hammock.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court makes a record and finds Defendant is not competent and is committed to restore competency. Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for November 24, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
Original filed in case #2014CF000063
Competency Report

Defendant Patrick J Niergarth in court, in custody with attorney Rebecca Hammock.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court grants request to continue this matter and orders updated competency report. Minutes filed.  Competency hearing scheduled for August 15, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Rebecca Hammock

Defendant Patrick J Niergarth in court, in custody with attorney Rebecca Hammock.  Valerian A. Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant disagrees with Doctor's finding regarding competency and requests hearing. Minutes filed.  Competency hearing scheduled for July 23, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
Original Bond filed with Court.  Defendant refused to sign bond.

Total Bond: 14CF279, 14CF107 and 14CF63.   Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Any prescribed medication is to be taken within the terms / limits of the prescription.  Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH DETECTIVE D.S. OR HIS RESIDENCE. NO CONTACT WITH SPEEDWAY IN DELAVAN.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant appears in court, in custody, with Edward Bailey and attorney Nepomiachi. Haley Rea and intern Andrew Herrmann appear for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed. Court finds there is reason to doubt defendants competency to proceed and orders a competency examination.
